abstract: Code names and helicopters helped keep Comcast’s efforts to buy NBC from G.E. quiet.
snippet: Code names and helicopters helped keep Comcast’s efforts to buy NBC from G.E. quiet.
lead_paragraph: The secret meeting was set for an early July afternoon in a condominium along the ninth hole of a golf course in Sun Valley, Idaho. Jeffrey R. Immelt, General Electric’s chief executive, arrived first, taking care to avoid being spotted by his own employee, Jeff Zucker, the chief executive of NBC Universal, who was mingling with other executives nearby.

headline.main: In Secret Meetings, Comcast Wooed G.E. and Won NBC

byline.original: By Andrew Ross Sorkin and Tim Arango

abstract: Code names and helicopters helped keep the wraps on Comcast’s efforts to buy NBC from G.E., a deal that will once again reshape the media landscape.
snippet: Code names and helicopters helped keep the wraps on Comcast’s efforts to buy NBC from G.E., a deal that will once again reshape the media landscape.
lead_paragraph: The secret meeting was set for an early July afternoon in a condominium along the ninth hole of a golf course in Sun Valley, Idaho. Jeffrey R. Immelt, General Electric‘s chief executive, arrived first, taking care to avoid being spotted by his own employee, Jeff Zucker, the chief executive of NBC Universal, who was mingling with other executives nearby.

headline.main: In Secret, Comcast Wooed G.E. and Won NBC

abstract: After nearly nine months of negotiations, Comcast, the nation’s largest cable operator, finally reached an agreement on Thursday to acquire NBC Universal from the General Electric Company.
snippet: After nearly nine months of negotiations, Comcast, the nation’s largest cable operator, finally reached an agreement on Thursday to acquire NBC Universal from the General Electric Company.
lead_paragraph: Updated: After nearly nine months of negotiations, Comcast, the nation’s largest cable operator, finally reached an agreement on Thursday to acquire NBC Universal from the General Electric Company.

headline.main: G.E. Agrees to Sell Control of NBC Universal to Comcast

abstract: For Comcast, the purchase is the realization of its long-held ambition to be a major producer of television shows and movies.
snippet: For Comcast, the purchase is the realization of its long-held ambition to be a major producer of television shows and movies.
lead_paragraph: After nearly nine months of negotiations, Comcast, the nation’s largest cable operator, announced an agreement on Thursday to acquire NBC Universal from the General Electric Company.

headline.main: G.E. Makes It Official: NBC Will Go to Comcast
headline.print_headline: G.E. Makes It Official: NBC Will Go to Comcast

abstract: The joint venture with NBC Universal will allow Comcast to become a leader in “anytime, anywhere” media, the company says.

headline.main: Comcast Calls NBC Universal a ‘Perfect Fit’

abstract: After nearly eight months of negotiations, Comcast, the largest U.S. cable operator, finally reached an agreement on Thursday to acquire the television network, NBC Universal, from the General Electric Company at a price of about $30 billion.
snippet: After nearly eight months of negotiations, Comcast, the largest U.S. cable operator, finally reached an agreement on Thursday to acquire the television network, NBC Universal, from the General Electric Company at a price of about $30 billion.
lead_paragraph: After nearly eight months of negotiations, Comcast, the nation’s largest cable operator, finally reached an agreement on Thursday to acquire the television network, NBC Universal, from the General Electric Company in a deal valuing the network at $30 billion.

headline.main: At Last, G.E. and Comcast Announce NBC Deal

lead_paragraph: It is the largest media deal to come down the pike in some time, and it’s complicated.

abstract: From Media Decoder: Foreseeing a long regulatory fight in its bid to control NBC Universal, Comcast outlined a number of public interest elements of the deal on Thursday morning and said it remained committed to free over-the-air television for the storied broadcast network NBC.

headline.main: Comcast Readies Itself for Long Regulatory Fight

abstract: With the sale of NBC Universal, Comcast gains a network news division, two cable news channels, and a set of local stations. With them comes a public service responsibility.
snippet: With the sale of NBC Universal, Comcast gains a network news division, two cable news channels, and a set of local stations. With them comes a public service responsibility.
lead_paragraph: “Good morning. We’ve been sold,” Meredith Vieira said Thursday morning, starting NBC’s “Today” show. “General Electric has signed an agreement this morning to sell control of NBC Universal, our parent company, to Comcast, creating one of the biggest media companies in history.”

headline.main: Comcast, You’re in the News Business Now

abstract: Shares in Comcast and General Electric popped in early morning trading on Thursday, as investors signaled approval of the deal between the two over NBC Universal.
snippet: Shares in Comcast and General Electric popped in early morning trading on Thursday, as investors signaled approval of the deal between the two over NBC Universal.
lead_paragraph: Five years ago, Comcast‘s stock was pummeled by investors angry over the cable giant’s hostile bid for the Walt Disney Company.

abstract: Eventually, the name NBC, short for the National Broadcasting Company, could go the way of history. Given both companies’ emphasis on cable channels, a name like Comcast Entertainment may make more sense in the long term.

abstract: Google caves. Or negotiates. Or tweaks its search of news content.
snippet: Google caves. Or negotiates. Or tweaks its search of news content.
lead_paragraph: Decoder was so busy watching the Comcast deal flow — billions in the balance! secret meetings on the golf course! another reason to complain about your cable company! — that Google’s decision to address the concerns of publishers by altering its First Click Free program went whooshing right by us on Wednesday.

headline.main: A Tweak in Google’s Relationship With Publishers

abstract: After nearly nine months of negotiations, Comcast, the nation’s largest cable operator, finally reached an agreement on Thursday to acquire NBC Universal from the General Electric Company.

headline.main: Comcast Buys a Majority Stake in NBC

abstract: The specter of past media merger failures, most notably the deal between Time Warner and AOL, inevitably hangs over the Comcast-NBC Universal deal.
snippet: The specter of past media merger failures, most notably the deal between Time Warner and AOL, inevitably hangs over the Comcast-NBC Universal deal.
lead_paragraph: The first question Brian Roberts, Comcast’s chief executive, was asked on a conference call with reporters Thursday morning was about the viability of broadcast television. Mr. Roberts, who has gone to great lengths to emphasize to his own shareholders that the deal’s rationale is to acquire NBC Universal’s fast-growing cable channels, said of broadcast, “I think there’s more upside than downside.”

headline.main: Comcast and G.E. Executives Explain Joint Venture

abstract: From Media Decoder: Comcast’s chief executive, Brian Roberts, answered a flurry of questions on a conference call Thursday, including his thoughts on the future of broadcast television and whether his media megadeal is comparable to the ill-fated AOL-Time Warner merger.

headline.main: Comcast and G.E. Execs Explain Joint Venture

abstract: NBC Universal’s chief executive said that the company would remain a bidder for the Olympic games in 2014 and 2016.
snippet: NBC Universal’s chief executive said that the company would remain a bidder for the Olympic games in 2014 and 2016.
lead_paragraph: In the months ahead, while Comcast’s bid to gain control of NBC Universal is being reviewed by regulators, General Electric will remain in charge of the media company. The G.E. chief executive, Jeffrey Immelt, said Thursday that G.E. would consult Comcast on occasion over certain deals.

headline.main: NBC Will Continue to Bid for Olympics Rights
